text: Press Releases Getting To Know The Breed Of Sri Lankan Resorts And Hill Retreats – A Pure Fun Guide For You! If you are making a trip to Sri Lanka, then it is important that you go through the list of tourist resorts and retreats. Ichiqoo, the trip planner is going to assist you in making your trip more enjoyable and exciting. Sri Lanka, 25 September 2015 -- Time to say a good-bye to the civil war – Sri Lanka is preparing something new for the travel-bees!! Though some of the climatic attacks like the giant tsunami attack in the 2004, together with the decades-long civil war shook the whole of Sri Lanka, it is slowly gathering its steps to attract more tourists and to sprint-ahead, with development in the tourism-areas like the resorts and the hotels. The Sri Lankan resorts and the holiday retreats now emphasize on concepts like simplicity, the local pride and charm. Some of the attractions on the island include the ancient ruins, the Buddhist culture, the exciting game park safaris, the local shopping and the fun-filled casinos. For more details visit http://www.ichiqoo.com Signature restaurants and spas have been refurbished and remodeled, with experiments that have become another major reason for attracting the foreigners to the island. Let us go, through the list of resorts, which are quite popular in the country: The retreats finally!!• Cinnamon Bey – golden spot in the golden sands of southwest Sri Lanka This retreat is present in the small fishing village of Beruwala, which were first founded by the Muslim traders in the early 8th century. Together with its Arabic roots and the vibrant colors, the hotel gets a nod from the tourists. Just go through the restaurants, explore through the local foods, venture through the Sinharaja forest and then catch the photos of the langurs, the butterflies and the reptiles through your camera. The rates and the pricing of the holiday retreat is also favorable.• Lunuganga – the glory which stands in the shade of Dedduwa Lake If you have heard about Geoffrey Bawa, then you might also be interested in the field of architecture. One of the popular Sri Lankan artists, he loved to design his dream home and designated the name “Lunuganga”. He bought the hotel in the year 1947 and almost spent 50 years of his life, in sculpting the home. Standing on the shore of the Dedduwa lake, Lunuganga possesses beautiful rooms decorated with the most traditional pieces like the antiques and the sculptures. Apart from this holiday home, he also built hospitals, schools, government buildings and his artistic talent was being proved in these. The hotel is also known for its tasty food.
